TopicTitle: Altitude boundary charts for science and warp speeds.

Articles.Content:
Updated: Visual polishing, one chart for science boundaries and another for warp boundaries.

Edited June 2, 2015 by LittleBlueGaming

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80220-Celestial-Body-Science-Multiplier-Editor

Will use your data to verify if the standard config of this still correct in 1.0.2 - so basically posting for future reference but nice chart, makes me think about a second monitor again, all this usful information in so many different files ... and I really do not want to waste paper on everything to only clutter my desk more.
That looks really cool. To be able to find it right when I need it, I personally think that picture would be a great addition to the wiki page itself.

KSP makes me want to get a 6 or 8 monitor setup

That looks really cool. To be able to find it right when I need it, I personally think that picture would be a great addition to the wiki page itself.

Thanks. I know it could really benefit from some proper design though, I'm just not very good at that kind of thing.
This is such a great idea. It would be awesome if you would do the same thing for non-physics warp levels.
Very cool. Visual aids are the best.

This is such a great idea. It would be awesome if you would do the same thing for non-physics warp levels.
